awd_titl_txt: High Temperature Elasticity of Iron-Bearing Minerals
awd_abstract_narration: This work will focus on the measurements of elastic                        constants of geophysically important minerals at high                           temperatures (above 1500 K, or in some cases up to the melting                  point), and especially those of iron bearing minerals such as                   fayalite, olivine, and pyroxene.  This will require setting up a                controlled flow oxygen pressure environment around the                          experiment, similar to that used in defect studies, and will                    require the use of new specialized talent skilled in oxygen                     fugacity control.  The anharmonic properties and empirical                      relationships between anharmonic properties at high temperature                 for the three minerals will be measured.  These relationships are               very helpful in giving constraints on mantle convection theories                and seismic tomography.
